column4: I have some source for an application I'd like to install, however, I am clueless as how to compile source to be able to use it.
Anyone have any information on compiling source with Ubuntu?
Just a vocoder application for audio.
What is the next step I need to take?
Unfortunately there is no configure file.
Is there some step to compile/build the code into a binary I can use? o.O
remember to always search the desired program on the repositories before compiling anything
This is some little vocoder written for SuSE
Doubt Synaptic would have had it.
It was tested successfully for Ubuntu, though. But I'll check.
the common steps are ./configure, make, make install
